text: The Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Dramatic Series is one of the annual Directors Guild of America Awards given by the Directors Guild of America. It was first presented at the 24th Directors Guild of America Awards in 1972. The current eligibility period is the calendar year. ==Winners and nominees== ===1970s=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5" |- ! width="7%" | Year ! width="20%" | Program ! width="20%" | Episode ! width="20%" | Winners and nominees ! width="3%" | Network ! width="2%" | |- |rowspan=3 style="text-align:center;"| 1971 (24th) |style="background:#FAEB86;" | The Man and the City |style="background:#FAEB86;" | "Hands of Love" |style="background:#FAEB86;" | Daniel Petrie |style="background:#FAEB86;" | ABC |rowspan="3" style="text- align:center;"| |- ||Birdbath |rowspan=2 style="text-align: center;"|– |Lamont Johnson |rowspan=2|PBS |- |Samuel Beckett's Beginning to End |Lewis Freedman |- |rowspan=3 style="text-align:center;"| 1972 (25th) |style="background:#FAEB86;" | The Waltons |style="background:#FAEB86;" | "Dust Bowl Cousins" |style="background:#FAEB86;" | Robert Butler |style="background:#FAEB86;" | CBS |rowspan="3" style="text-align:center;"| |- |Hawaii Five-O |"V for Fashion" |Charles S.
